maml:description.maml:para: Establishes a connection to the FleetDM API
Connects to a FleetDM instance using either an API token or email/password credentials. The connection is stored at the module level and used by all other FleetDM cmdlets.
The base URI of your FleetDM instance (e.g., https://fleet.example.com)
A secure string containing the FleetDM API token. This is the preferred method for automation and API-only users.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The base URI of your FleetDM instance (e.g., https://fleet.example.com)
PSCredential object containing email and password for FleetDM authentication. Use this for interactive sessions or when token authentication is not available.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The base URI of your FleetDM instance (e.g., https://fleet.example.com)
A secure string containing the FleetDM API token. This is the preferred method for automation and API-only users.
PSCredential object containing email and password for FleetDM authentication. Use this for interactive sessions or when token authentication is not available.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: Connects to FleetDM using an API token
Prompts for credentials and connects to FleetDM
Prompts for API token securely and connects to FleetDM

maml:description.maml:para: Disconnects from the FleetDM API
Closes the current FleetDM connection and clears stored authentication information. After disconnecting, you must run Connect-FleetDM before using other FleetDM cmdlets.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: Disconnects from the current FleetDM instance
Disconnects and shows verbose information about the disconnection process

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves host information from FleetDM
Gets one or more hosts from FleetDM with optional filtering by status, team, or hostname. Supports retrieving a specific host by ID or searching for hosts based on various criteria.
The specific host ID to retrieve. When specified, returns detailed information for a single host.
Include policy compliance information in the response
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Filter hosts by status: online, offline, or missing
Search for hosts by hostname (partial match supported)
Filter hosts by policy ID
Filter hosts by software ID
Filter hosts by operating system name
Filter hosts by operating system version
Include software inventory in the response. This significantly increases response size.
Include policy compliance information in the response
Filter to only show hosts with failing policies disabled
Include device mapping information
Filter by MDM ID
Filter by MDM enrollment status
Filter by Munki issue ID
Filter hosts with low disk space (less than specified GB)
Filter by label name or ID
Page number for pagination (0-based)
Number of results per page (default: 100)
Field to sort by (hostname, created_at, updated_at)
Sort direction (asc or desc)
Return hosts added after this date
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The specific host ID to retrieve. When specified, returns detailed information for a single host.
Filter hosts by status: online, offline, or missing
Search for hosts by hostname (partial match supported)
Filter hosts by policy ID
Filter hosts by software ID

Filter hosts by operating system version
Include software inventory in the response. This significantly increases response size.
Include policy compliance information in the response
Filter to only show hosts with failing policies disabled
Include device mapping information

Filter by Munki issue ID
Filter hosts with low disk space (less than specified GB)
Filter by label name or ID

Number of results per page (default: 100)

Gets all online hosts

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-FleetHost -OSName "macOS" -Status online | Select-Object id, hostname, primary_ip

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets all online macOS hosts and displays their ID, hostname, and IP

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves saved queries from FleetDM
Gets one or more saved queries from FleetDM with optional filtering. Use this to find query IDs for use with Invoke-FleetQuery or Invoke-FleetSavedQuery.

Filter queries by name (partial match)

Number of results per page (default: 100)

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-FleetQuery | Where-Object { $_.query -like "*chrome*" } | Format-Table id, name, query -Wrap

dev:remarks.maml:para: Lists all queries that reference Chrome

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves software inventory from FleetDM
Gets software inventory information from FleetDM. Can retrieve all software or filter by various criteria. Software inventory includes installed applications, versions, and vulnerability information.
The specific software ID to retrieve

Filter software by name (partial match)
Filter software by version
Filter software by CVE (Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures) ID
Only return software with known vulnerabilities

Number of results per page (default: 100)
Sort results by this field (name, hosts_count, cve_published, cve_resolved)
Sort direction (asc or desc)

Filter software by version
Filter software by CVE (Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures) ID
Only return software with known vulnerabilities

maml:description.maml:para: Invokes a custom FleetDM API method
Provides direct access to any FleetDM API endpoint not covered by specific cmdlets. This is useful for accessing new or undocumented API endpoints.
The API endpoint path (without /api/v1/fleet/ prefix)
The HTTP method to use (GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE)
The request body as a hashtable (will be converted to JSON)
Query parameters as a hashtable
Automatically follow pagination to retrieve all results (for GET requests)
Return the raw response object without processing
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The API endpoint path (without /api/v1/fleet/ prefix)
The HTTP method to use (GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE)
The request body as a hashtable (will be converted to JSON)
Query parameters as a hashtable
Automatically follow pagination to retrieve all results (for GET requests)
Return the raw response object without processing
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new team
Triggers a refetch for host ID 123

maml:description.maml:para: Executes a live query on FleetDM hosts

Runs an osquery SQL statement on specified hosts and returns the results. For ad-hoc queries, automatically creates a temporary saved query, runs it, retrieves the results, and cleans up. This provides actual query results instead of just campaign information.
The SQL query to execute. This should be a valid osquery SQL statement.
Array of host IDs to run the query on. Accepts pipeline input.
Array of label names to run the query on all hosts with those labels
Run the query on all hosts in the fleet (not supported by FleetDM API for ad-hoc queries)
For saved queries (QueryId), returns results directly instead of starting a campaign. This parameter is deprecated for ad-hoc queries as they now always return results.
Maximum time to wait for results in seconds (default: 25)
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The ID of a saved query to execute (alternative to providing Query text)
Array of host IDs to run the query on. Accepts pipeline input.
Array of label names to run the query on all hosts with those labels
Run the query on all hosts in the fleet (not supported by FleetDM API for ad-hoc queries)
For saved queries (QueryId), returns results directly instead of starting a campaign. This parameter is deprecated for ad-hoc queries as they now always return results.
Maximum time to wait for results in seconds (default: 25)
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The SQL query to execute. This should be a valid osquery SQL statement.
The ID of a saved query to execute (alternative to providing Query text)
Array of host IDs to run the query on. Accepts pipeline input.
Array of label names to run the query on all hosts with those labels
Run the query on all hosts in the fleet (not supported by FleetDM API for ad-hoc queries)
For saved queries (QueryId), returns results directly instead of starting a campaign. This parameter is deprecated for ad-hoc queries as they now always return results.
Maximum time to wait for results in seconds (default: 25)
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: Runs a system info query on specific hosts and returns the actual results

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $hosts = Get-FleetHost -Status online $results = $hosts | Invoke-FleetQuery -Query "SELECT * FROM users WHERE uid = '501';"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets all online hosts and runs a query to find user with UID 501, returning results
Runs a query on all hosts with the "production" label (returns campaign info only)
Executes saved query #42 on specific hosts and waits for results
Pipes host IDs to run OS version query

maml:description.maml:para: Executes a saved query and returns results immediately
Runs a saved FleetDM query against specified hosts and returns the results directly. Unlike Invoke-FleetQuery which starts a campaign, this function waits for and returns results.
The query will stop if targeted hosts haven't responded within the configured timeout period.
The ID of the saved query to execute
Array of host IDs to run the query on. Accepts pipeline input.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The ID of the saved query to execute
Array of host IDs to run the query on. Accepts pipeline input.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: Runs saved query 42 on hosts 1, 2, and 3
Runs saved query 15 on all online hosts
Runs query and formats results

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new policy in FleetDM
Creates a new policy in FleetDM. Policies are compliance rules that are regularly checked on hosts.
The name of the policy
The SQL query that defines the policy check. Should return 1 row for compliant hosts.
A description of what the policy checks
Steps to resolve the issue when the policy fails
The platform this policy applies to (windows, linux, darwin, chrome, or all)
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The name of the policy
The SQL query that defines the policy check. Should return 1 row for compliant hosts.
A description of what the policy checks
Steps to resolve the issue when the policy fails
The platform this policy applies to (windows, linux, darwin, chrome, or all)
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-FleetPolicy -Name "Firewall Enabled" -Query "SELECT 1 FROM windows_firewall WHERE enabled = 1;"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a basic policy to check if Windows Firewall is enabled

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $params = @{ Name = "FileVault Enabled" Query = "SELECT 1 FROM filevault_status WHERE status = 'on';" Description = "Ensures FileVault disk encryption is enabled" Resolution = "Enable FileVault in System Preferences > Security & Privacy" Platform = "darwin" } New-FleetPolicy @params

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a comprehensive macOS policy with all details
Bulk creates policies from a CSV file

maml:description.maml:para: Removes hosts from FleetDM
Removes one or more hosts from FleetDM. Supports pipeline input for bulk operations. Use with caution as this operation cannot be undone.
The ID(s) of the host(s) to remove. Accepts pipeline input.
Skip confirmation prompts
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The ID(s) of the host(s) to remove. Accepts pipeline input.
Skip confirmation prompts
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes host with ID 123 after confirmation
Removes host with ID 123 without confirmation
Removes all offline hosts without confirmation
Shows what would happen if you removed hosts 123, 456, and 789
Removes all hosts with hostnames starting with "old-" after confirmation for each

maml:description.maml:para: Updates an existing policy in FleetDM
Updates an existing policy in FleetDM. You can update the name, query, description, resolution, and platform.
The ID of the policy to update
The new name for the policy
The new SQL query that defines the policy
The new description of what the policy checks
The new resolution steps for when the policy fails
The new platform filter for the policy (windows, linux, darwin, chrome, all)
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The ID of the policy to update
The new name for the policy
The new SQL query that defines the policy
The new description of what the policy checks
The new resolution steps for when the policy fails
The new platform filter for the policy (windows, linux, darwin, chrome, all)
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates just the name of policy ID 123

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Set-FleetPolicy -Id 456 -Query "SELECT 1 FROM users WHERE username != 'root';" -Description "Ensures root account is disabled"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates the query and description for policy ID 456
Gets a policy by name and updates it to have a new name

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $updateParams = @{ Id = 789 Name = "Comprehensive Update" Query = "SELECT 1 FROM system_info WHERE version >= '11.0';" Description = "Ensures minimum OS version" Resolution = "Update to macOS 11.0 or higher" Platform = "darwin" } Set-FleetPolicy @updateParams

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates multiple properties of a policy using splatting
